pageContext.claim: “But I will tell you this, China's economy if it's in trouble, it's only in trouble because of me. That's the only reason it's in trouble, because I have placed billions and billions -- we have taken in $11 billion worth of taxes that I taxed China.”
pageContext.analysis: Tariffs are not a tax paid by China; U.S. importers and ultimately U.S. consumers foot the bill for Trump's tariffs on Chinese goods. Trump incorrectly says that China's economy is "only in trouble because of me." Analysts say that the Chinese economy is mostly losing steam because of domestic reasons, such as infrastructure spending contracting and slowing car sales.
